item.title: Victoria add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "You cannot find peace by avoiding life." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "When the Day of Judgment dawns and people, great and small, come marching in to receive their heavenly rewards, the Almighty will gaze upon the mere bookworms and say to Peter, â€œLook, these need no reward. We have nothing to give them. They have loved reading." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Nothing thicker than a knife's blade separates happiness from melancholy." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "No need to hurry. No need to sparkle. No need to be anybody but oneself." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "All thinking men are atheists." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "No, that is the great fallacy: the wisdom of old men. They do not grow wise. They grow careful." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "Be thankful that you have a life, and forsake your vain and presumptuous desire for a second one." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "The world and the universe is an extremely beautiful place, and the more we understand about it the more beautiful does it appear." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "Indeed, organizing atheists has been compared to herding cats, because they tend to think independently and will not conform to authority. But a good first step would be to build up a critical mass of those willing to 'come out,' thereby encouraging others to do so. Even if they can't be herded, cats in sufficient numbers can make a lot of noise and they cannot be ignored." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Victoria add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "What greater gift than the love of a cat." -- Charles Dickens
